channel.title: Java beginner help

item.title: Java beginner help
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Use the String.equals(String other) function to compare strings, not the == operator.

The function checks the actual contents of the string, the == operator checks whether the references to the objects are equal.

Read full topic

[/quote]
Why not actually? Because they both another underlaying unique number or something? I’ve read something about it ‘aliasing’ but I don’t really get it.[/quote]

== just compares the references I think.

item.title: Java beginner help
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

You forgot the double ==.

if (userconfirm == correct){

And userconfirm is a Scanner object, not a boolean.
You can ‘scan’ the next string from the command line input by using

Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in)
String userconfirm = scanner.nextLine();

So the if statement would be

if(userconfirm == correct) {
   /* Body */
}

Oh and btw. You can’t create multiple Scanner objects because System.in is static. (Actually you can, but they will all contain the same data)

Also you should work on your coding conventions.
The class’s name should be Test. (With the capital letter.)
And the fields (Scanner userconfirm etc.) should be userConfirm, myUser and nextUser.

Read full topic

item.title: Java beginner help
item.dc:creator: @V113 V1
item.description:
@V113 wrote:

Lol, ok firstly i’m the biggest noob in the world at coding. I’m 15 years of age and figured i should take a whack at it…
basically, the code you see below is my test at a user sending a message to another user. It’s all ok until i get to the if statement? …

What i’m looking for is if the user inputs the word “yes” then it prints another line out… but i think i must of forgotten something? It’s obviously not gonna send a message, but this is the first code ive ever done? it’s not finished either, i’m obviously not just going to end the code like that lol … it’s giving me an error saying this: [code] found : java.lang.String
required: java.util.Scanner
if (userconfirm = correct){

found : java.util.Scanner
required: boolean
if (userconfirm = correct){
2 errors
BUILD FAILED (total time: 0 seconds)
[/code]

here’s my code:

[code] import java.util.Scanner;

class test{

public static void main(String args[]){
    boolean confirm;
    String correct;
    correct = "yes";
    Scanner userconfirm = new Scanner(System.in);
    Scanner myuser = new Scanner(System.in);
    Scanner nxtuser = new  Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.println("Welcome to Jav4Chat");
    System.out.println("Please enter your username: ");
    System.out.print(myuser.nextLine());
    System.out.println("Welcome " + myuser + "!");
    System.out.println("please enter your partners user here: ");
    System.out.println(nxtuser.nextLine());
    System.out.println("You're sending a message to " + nxtuser +
            "is this correct?");
    System.out.println(userconfirm.nextLine());
    if (userconfirm = correct){
        confirm = true;
        
    }
    
            
} [/code] ... before you post comments lol, i realise. I Am A Noob. :P ... we all start somewhere though right?

Read full topic
